sourceDesc.p: created on Wednesday 03rd September 2008 02:04:26 PM by the form at http://www.tei-c.org.uk/Roma/

list.head: Main change: allow MML3 content of formula to be validated
list.item: Removed ODD declaration for mml:math element.
Changed reference to mml:math to use the prefix (i.e., m_math rather than just math)
Added prefix to the moduleRef that grabs the MML3 schema.
Copied the declarations that the TEI Stylesheets fails to copy over from MML3 into the content child of that moduleRef, and change all the names to use the prefix.

list.head: Incidental changes (mostly small)
list.item: Changed xml-model PIs so that this file is validated against version 4.4.0 of tei_customization, rather than the copy used for the WWP seminars which (as of this writing) is version 3.5.0.
Tied the output schema to TEI P5 4.4.0 via the source attribute of schemaSpec.
Separately encoded the three people listed as the authors, thus to give them separate IDs.
Changed the who attributes of change to be pointers (to the aforementioned).
Re-arranged order of namespace declarations on outermost TEI.
Removed typeNote from except of the header moduleRef, as it is from the msdescription module.
added controlled value list for status on availability to support custom Creative Commons licenses
added controlled value list to mimeType on media
removed units from values of height and width on media
added lang to eg with controlled code language values
added lang to code with controlled code language values
add formula to content model of eg
attempt to restore rows and cols to cell

finished adding MathML support to the schema: adding a moduleRef that references the MathML schema, so that the inclusion of the math element inside formula is valid. There are still some loose ends; using the prefix on moduleRef to provide an "mml" prefix to the math element doesn't work, so I've omitted it for now. Also, MathML is validating only partially.
added xenodata to support embedded iframes.
modified content model of label to allow bibl and q as children (to support annotated bibliographies such as 000111.xml)
changed dhq:media to tei:media, modified to permit @poster and to constrain @type; also undeleted desc to allow it to appear within media
changed rng:ref name="data.pointer" to dataRef key="teidata.pointer" throughout
reworked the deletion of global attributes to achieve greater nuance and to add @source on quote
changed content model of head to allow it to contain cit (to support the change from dhq:caption to head in article 000009.xml)
general debugging and validation of DHQ articles to discover and fix anomalies
Created new dhq:media element to better support embedded media.
Removed special values of @type on ptr which had been used to support embedded media
finalized constraints for foreign-language articles, made the dev version of the schema the formal public version
updated to pure ODD with Syd Bauman's help
made updates needed to accommodate articles in translation: added dhq:translatorInfo and children; added xml:lang to title; added extent to language
made changes needed to make ODD file valid against current odd4odds schema: added rng:group around content models, reversed the deletion of the model.resourceLike class.
changed the definition for revisionNote to remove @changeTargets and to allow ref inside revisionNote
added "revisionLoc" as a value for @type on anchor (to serve as an anchor for locations of revisions)
changed ODD to use @except and @include for element inclusion at the module level
fixed problem with duplicate declaration of @type on list
added @rend on table to support borders

revisionDesc.change: Added @biblioID to bibl to support reference to centralized bibliography.

list.item: Experimented with adding @rend to table to support "border". Now in the middle of troubleshooting problems with duplicate declarations for @type on title, not sure where these came from. Entire ODD really needs to be refactored.
add dhq:dedication
allow listBibl in body
add dhq:revisionNote
add "annotated_bibliography" as a value for @type on list
add @key to bibl to support centralized bibliography
